tn.text: AT: "proclaimed from Jerusalem"
The Hebrew text has "Jeconiah," which is a variation of the name "Jehoiachin." Many modern versions have "Jehoiachin" in order to make it clear that the same king is being referred to.
This title is often used for the king's mother.
AT: "very important officials"

tn.ref: Elasah son of Shapan and Gemariah son of Hilkiah
tn.text: These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
AT: "whom he caused" or "whom Yahweh caused"

tn.ref: Build houses and live in them. Plant gardens and eat their fruit
tn.text: Yahweh is telling them they will be there for a long time. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
AT: "have your sons get married"
AT: "allow your daughters to marry"
This refers to the city of Babylon.

tn.ref: Seek the peace of the city
tn.text: seek to Live peaceably with all people. Implying not to cause trouble and rebel against the authority.
Yahweh continues speaking to the captive Israelites.
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|1:8]]
Yahweh continues speaking about what will happen to the captives of Israel.
This refers to the captive Isrealites.
AT: " 70 years" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
Yahweh continues speaking about what will happen to the captives of Israel.

tn.ref: call to me ... pray to me
tn.text: These two phrases mean the same thing and emphasize that Yahweh will respond to their prayers. AT: "pray to me." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
This implies that Yahweh will give them what they want.

tn.ref: I will bring back your fortunes
tn.text: AT: "I will cause things to go well for you again"
Jeremiah speaks to the captive Israelites.

tn.ref: who sits on the throne of David
tn.text: This is a reference to the king of Judah who is one of David's descendants.
AT: "Look" or "listen" or "pay attention"

tn.ref: I am about to send sword, famine, and disease on them
tn.text: "Sword" represents warfare. AT: "I am going to punish them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: For I will make them like rotten figs that are too bad to be eaten
tn.text: AT: "I will punish them harshly" or "I will make their life bad" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: a horror, an object about curses and hissed words, and a shameful thing
tn.text: These words all share similar meanings and describe how the people of other nations will react when they see what Yahweh has done to the people of Judah.

The words "hissed words" refer to a sound of strong disapproval that people make when they say bad things about others. The phrase has basically the same meaning as "curses." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
AT: "obey"
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
AT: "Look" or "Listen" or "Pay attention to what I am about to tell you".

tn.ref: I am about to put them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar
tn.text: AT: "I will allow Nebuchadnezzar to conquer them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: a curse will be spoken about these persons
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The captives of Judah will say a curse about these persons" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
AT: "burned to death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: I am the one who knows; I am the witness
tn.text: These two clauses mean the same thing, and Yahweh repeats them for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a people group. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"Name" refers to a person's authority and reputation. AT: "based on your own authority and reputation" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This is a wooden frame to punish a person which holds the feet, hands, or head.
This finishes the letter by Shemaiah that he sent out to the people in Jerusalem.

tn.ref: why have you not rebuked Jeremiah of Anathoth, who makes himself into a prophet against you?
tn.text: AT: "you should have rebuked Jeremiah of Anathoth, who makes himself into a prophet speaking against you."
